alert.note: Alert for Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 1:07PM EST until December 12 at 12:15PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of DownEast and East Central Maine, including the following counties, in DownEast Maine, Hancock and Washington. In East Central Maine, Penobscot. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. While rainfall is coming to an end, it will take several hours for all the water to run off into local stream and creeks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 102 PM EST, While rainfall is tapering off in the warning area, some flooding will remain likely through late afternoon due to heavy rain and snowmelt earlier today. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen in portions of the warning area in Washington County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Calais, Machias, Lubec, Eastport, Cherryfield, Danforth, Vanceboro, Jonesport, Steuben, Harrington, Perry, Pembroke, Princeton, Jonesboro, Columbia Falls, Cutler, Columbia, Topsfield, Meddybemps and Grand Lake Stream. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
